clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison Between Bronchoscopy and Real- Time Ultrasound Guided Percutaneous Tracheostomy
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Between Bronchoscopy and Real- Time Ultrasound Guided Percutaneous Dilatational Tracheostomy for Safety, Complications and Efficiency in Critically Ill Patient

brief_summary.textblock: Trial is a randomized study to compare between ultrasound guided percutaneous tracheostomy and bronchoscopy guided percutaneous tracheostomy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Trial is a randomized study to compare between ultrasound guided percutaneous tracheostomy and bronchoscopy guided percutaneous tracheostomy.
Patients will be randomly assigned to be submitted to evaluate safety, complication rates, easy to perform , clinical outcomes and effectivity.

primary_outcome.measure: procedure failure of ultrasound to provide this anatomical information and ease of perform
primary_outcome.time_frame: During percutaneous tracheostomy an expected average time 20 minutes
primary_outcome.description: occurence of a major complications: bleeding, subcutaneous emphysema, oesophageal perforation, number of applied needle interventions, procedure duration, cardiorespiratory arrest

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during percutaneous tracheostomy ( average expected time 20 minutes)
secondary_outcome.description: the procedure duration was taken as the time that elapsed from the placement of the needle to the placement of the tracheostomy cannula.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Pneumothorax due to the percutaneous tracheostomy detected by clinical examination during the procedure or chest x-ray after the procedure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Tracheal posterior wall injury as detected by bronchoscopy after the procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Accidental decannulation after the procedure during Hospital stay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during percutaneous tracheostomy an expected average of 20 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiorespiratory arrest due to percutaneous tracheostomy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Haemorrhage that could not be stopped by sponge wrapping the stoma after the procedure and/or blood coming with aspiration inside the tracheostomy tube was defined as minor bleeding

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the procedure an expected average of 20 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous haemorrhage from the stoma and/or from the trachea with aspiration despite compresses was defined as a major haemorrhage.

other_outcome.time_frame: During percutaneous tracheostomy an expected average of 20 minutes
other_outcome.description: Drop in peripheral oxygen saturation < 90% for more than 2 minutes as measured by pulse oximeter during the procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All intubated and mechanically ventilated patients indicated for a tracheostomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with tracheal or neck abnormalities, soft tissue infection in the neck, neck surgery history, oxygenation problems , coagulation disorders or coagulation parameter changes and those requiring urgent or surgery patients unable to provide informed consent.
